content: @WG-prioritization I was wondering if we should keep opening topics for nominations, backports, etc
I find that we never fill issues descriptions using those and it makes me review more stuff when I build the agenda
I want to hear opinions from others but I'm tempted to stop opening those topics

I personally also prefer not opening these as they make it harder to look for remaining "to prioritize" issues.

It's not a big problem for me though, so if someone uses these rn I don't mind keeping them
i was wondering if we should keep track of backports etc (to check if they get merged before hand or if anything is required )
@LeSeulArtichaut removing this would be just removing the entries from triagebot.toml on rust repo, right?

DPC said:

i was wondering if we should keep track of backports etc (to check if they get merged before hand or if anything is required )

I don't think so, what I usually do is on wednesday's I go over the request and follow what's documented on our procedure
actually doing these kind of things waaay before the meeting may even be a waste of time, imagine a P-critical issue that is open today but on wednesday is already fixed
we would be adding it to the agenda, checking status, explaining the issue and then at the time of the meeting that won't be needed
that's why I do most of this work on wednesdays
prioritizing I-prioritize issues is something that is nice if done everyday and async but the rest of the stuff seems more problematic if we do beforehand and open requests from them

@Santiago Pastorino if I understand, you are referrirng to notifications for patches to be backported (Backport) and nominated for discussion (I-nominated). Why were these notifications triggered to the WG-prio and do we really need them? Should they be added to agenda meetings? Do we need to do anything on them?
If no, I agree we can remove them.
oh I see just now that a patch has been merged: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75496
@apiraino we need to summarize all that into the agenda

but the topics created on Zulip like https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/245100-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization.2Falerts/topic/Backport.20.2375494.20Don't.20immediately.20error.20for.20cycles.20during.20n.E2.80.A6 are not helping at all because we are not using that to fill the agenda
so it's bothering more than being something useful
